alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 5:10AM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF TODAY. THE NEXT STORM WILL ARRIVE LATE MONDAY... .Winter weather advisories will end this morning with little to no additional accumulations. Cascade mountains will see light snow through mid morning. The next storm will arrive late Monday and continue through Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Potlatch, Genesee, Moscow, and Plummer. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
